results.title: Yorke Peninsula
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description: The sea in its various moods is the central “character” in this exploration of the scenery and recreational opportunities of Yorke Peninsula in South Australia. The agricultural and mining background of this region adds a further dimension to its natural pleasures.

results.title: York Cathedral
results.brief_description: A study of York Minister, famous for its XIV century west front, its solemn and impressive nave, lofty choir, and beautiful reredos. Includes views of transepts, Lady Chapel, High Alter, ancient stained glass windows, sculptures, and the relics of the crypt.

results.title: Yol
results.creator_credit: Cactus Films, Films A2, Guney Film, Maran Film, Schweizer Fernselen, DRS, Yilmaz Guney, Edi Hubschmid and Serif Goren
results.brief_description: Five political prisoners are given one week’s reprieve to go and visit their families. One man returns to find that his adulterous wife is being kept prisoner by his father-in-law who expects him to kill her. Another returns to his village but cannot marry the woman he loves because custom decrees he must marry his widowed sister-in-law; another finds his family has shunned him for confessing to the authorities. As the men spread out across Turkey’s vast terrain, “Yol” explores the strictures of tradition on family and on marriage. The men, all of whom must return to their prison cells, are prisoners of an authoritarian state. Their women and their children are prisoners of an equally authoritarian patriarchy. Guney was himself a political prisoner, incarcerated for his intellectual activism against state militarism, when he wrote the script to “Yol”, which was smuggled out to Serif Goren, who directed the film for Guney. Guney escaped to Switzerland where he completed the film. Though the social, political and gender relationships explored in the film are harsh and unrelenting, what is transcendant about “Yol” is the deeply rigorous humanism that Guney and Goren extend to all their characters. That Guney and Goren were able to complete the film is a testament itself to their intelligence and dedication to a cinema of enlightenment. This film is one of cinema’s greatest laments against the violence of patriarchy and one of the great emancipist works about the possibilities of change and transformation. (Awards: Winner of the Palme d’Or at Cannes. Winner of the International Critic’s Prize) In Turkish with English subtitles.

results.title: Yokihi = Princess Yang Kwei Fei
results.creator_credit: Daiei Motion Picture Company, Shaw Brothers, Masaichi Nagata, Run Run Shaw and Kenji Mizoguchi
results.brief_description:
The Chinese Emperor Genso of the Tang Dynast marries a beautiful scullery maid on the death of his wife, with whom he falls in love. The new empress is destroyed by jealousies and intrigue around her as a popular revolt rises against the couple. This film uses an exquisite colour range with costumes and decor to relay the characters’ emotional turmoil. A film about political intrigue and corruption in 8th century China, ‘Princess Yang Kwei Fei’ depicts the dying stages of a dynasty. In the film’s final scenes the Emperor, who has survived the uprising but is old and unhappy, is mystically reunited with his deceased wife.

Credits: Producer, Masaichi Nagata, Run Run Shaw ; director, Kenji Mizoguchi ; writer, Yoda Yoshikata, Matsutaro Kawaguchi, Masashige Narusawa, Tao Jin ; photography, Kohei Sugiyama ; music, Hayasaka Fumio.
Cast: Machiko Kyo, Masayuki Mori, So Yamamura, Eitaro Ozawa, Eitaro Shindo, Haruko Sugimura.

results.title: Yoke Heng's story
results.creator_credit: Malayan Film Unit and Brian Salt
results.brief_description: Deals with Singapore’s social welfare services. Tells the story of Yoke Heng, a sixteen-year-old boy from crowded Chinatown show cares for his five brothers and sisters while both his parents are in hospital. The hospital almoner is able to help the family secure one of the modern flats being erected on the outskirts of the city. On the parents’ recovery, the family is reunited in their new home.

results.title: Yoga for health
results.creator_credit: Ministry of Information and Broadcasting, M. Bhavnani and A. Bhaskar Rao
results.brief_description: An introduction to the ancient science of Yoga. Yoga is the disciplining of all human powers - physical, metal, moral and spiritual. Then aim is not only bodily strength but health, stamina and mental awareness - qualities that people need whether at work or play. This documentary shows some Asanas which, if practised, can serve as a foundation of good health.

results.title: Yoga for beginners
results.brief_description: Beginner’s guide to Hatha Yoga, this progressive system of movement, relaxation techniques and breathing awareness helps you develop strength and flexibility, reduce stress, increase energy and enhance concentration. Join Patricia Walden as she takes you through a safe and easy to follow contemporary approach to this classical discipline, appropriate for beginner’s and advanced students alike. You can also tailor the program to suit your individual needs, using the step by step instructions in yoga basics for the standing poses, seated poses, inverted poses and gentle guidance into breathing awareness and relaxation as well as 3 short form individual practice sessions.

results.title: Yoga and the individual
results.creator_credit: John B Murray Productions and John B Murray
results.brief_description: Introduces Yoga as taught in Australia, briefly discussing its background in Indian thought. Vijayadev Yogendra and Jill Yogendra demonstrate the special exercises of the physical system, and their relation to the system of meditation is briefly explained.

results.title: Yirawala: Picasso of Arnhem Land
results.creator_credit: Morning Star Productions and Sandra Holmes
results.brief_description: Examines the sentiment and philosophy of artist Yirawala, MBE, spiritual leader of the Gunwingu tribe who fought to stop uranium mining and the destruction of his land and religion. Examines many of the bark paintings of Yirawala and the myths behind them.

results.title: Yipirinya
results.creator_credit: Rusden State College, Eli Rubintia and Joanne Bradford
results.brief_description: The story of the Aboriginal school Yipirinya, at Alice Springs, which attempts to teach Aboriginal children their own language and culture.
